channel.title: Jaring - My new server
channel.description: I know this is the easiest thing to do with rsps, but this one for some reason will not jar, in any specific way. I also have another server that I wanted to try out and there's no client inside of it. If anyone could help I'd be really happy :). I got team viewer and everything. Thank you for spending your time reading this.

item.title: Jaring - My new server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Onyx12:

You can use any client? Oh, do I have to enter the IP in from the source or something.

Depends per client. You need to make sure the outstream from the server matches the instream of the client and vice versa.

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring - My new server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Onyx12, post:9, topic:548075”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666980.msg4460037#msg4460037 date=1417050318]

I did not want a picture of the connection error. That literally tells me nothing…
I said to show me the cmd.
And if the jar loaded obviously the jarmaker settings are correct.

No CMD opens when I open the client. So It’s Whatever. I’ll drop that server. But, I recently downloaded another source “Arios 498” and I got the package but no client came within the package. I was wondering if I had to make one or what? It has files in there but no “run.bat” or jars and so on. Here’s a screen shot of the folder.

http://prntscr.com/5aj8x5

If you run the .jar with the .bat file that JARMaker auto generates there would be one…

And if there’s no client, then use your own. It’s that simple.

If there’s no run.bat, either A) make one, or B) Get an IDE.

[/quote]

Any Guides on how to use your own client and or make your own run.bat. Please would help a lot :)[/quote]

For the run.bat:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:546619”]A great way to get around making scripts like this constantly, is to get an IDE like eclipse.

Well your script depends on a few things.
For the client:
Does it require any arguments on start up?
For instance:

public static void main(String args[]) { if(args.length != 5) { System.out.println("Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid"); return; }
As you can see, it wants the args to be a length of 5. And this one happens to tell you exactly what the arguments are.
Not all will (depending on the previous owner). Some don’t require any arguments because someone just set the defaults in the code.

Also, when talking about which java you want to use:
java.exe will run the command (your client/server/etc) and wait for the application to be completed (terminated, essentially) before going to the next command.
javaw.exe will run the command but will not wait for the application before going to the next one.
javac.exe will compile the inputted packages.

You don’t want the server to exit when it’s completed, in case it has errors. So you want to use java.exe for it.
You will want to use java.exe for the client as well, so you can see the errors. Otherwise, you can use javaw.exe
And then for compiling, obviously use javac.exe

To find the directories/packages to compile, it will depend how your client and source is set up.
Assuming your client doesn’t have any packages besides the sign (for signlink.java), you’d have the directories as (assuming your .bat file is not in the same folder as the .java files and they’re in a src folder):
src/.java src/sign/java

For your source, it’d be the same thing, but it’s packaged and has lots more directories for each package… So you’d have to find them all and list each one after the other. The script you first posted is a great example of that…

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\events*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java src\server\clip*.java src\server\clip\region*.java src\server\model\players\combat*.java src\server\model\players\content*.java
pause

(This is why we use IDEs, they find it all on their own, no work on your end )

Notable things in that script:
-classpath : A.K.A -cp .

Specify where to find user class files, and (optionally) annotation processors and source files. This class path overrides the user class path in the CLASSPATH environment variable. If neither CLASSPATH, -cp nor -classpath is specified, the user class path consists of the current directory

Then you see -d which is to:

Set the destination directory for class files.

See this documentation for more about these args.[/quote]

As for making a client… I don’t think you’d be able to…
when I say use your own I mean one from another source or etc. You can find plenty when you search for em on google.

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring - My new server
item.dc:creator: @Onyx12 Onyx12
item.description:
@Onyx12 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:548075”][quote author=Onyx12 link=topic=666980.msg4460018#msg4460018 date=1417046301]

You don’t Jar a server, you jar the client.
And be specific. How isn’t it Jaring?
If you’re using JARMaker, make sure you have the check box ticked for it to generate a .bat (for debugging). Run it using the .bat so you can see errors and etc.

If you’re using an IDE, the Jar you made wouldn’t have an issue…

Should I have the source open while trying to open the client?

I’ve tried to jar the client with all the class files in it, but when I click the .jar (Plus .bat is checked) The client will not open. The furthest I got it to after jaring 20 + times was to "connection error retrying in 5, 4, 3, etc etc…

I’ve been working on it forever, all I need done is the server jared.
[/quote]
What does the command prompt say when that error shows up?
Also that error is typically cache related (on a 317).[/quote]

I’ll Take Screenshots for you.

http://prntscr.com/5aiuff

http://prntscr.com/5aiuzu

http://prntscr.com/5aivrf

Read full topic
